reviews.review_msg: Mandana is a pretty good prof if you're good at studying on your own time. Her lectures were just reading off the powerpoint with some additional info given orally. Midterm and final exams were quite tough because there's alot of info to know for this course so make sure you study weekly.

She explain all materials from her slides straight-forward so it's easy to understand. Just don't skip class since sometimes she will choose student randomly according from student list. She also very helpful whenever you asked her.

slide does not include everything, literally the first practice question for chapter 3 was not in the slides. During class, she tends to mumble a lot and it became difficult to retain certain information. Would not take again unless major changes is made in her teaching techniques.

Make sure you attend each class, read book and lecture notes for weekly quizzes at tutorial. There are 3 assignments for the whole term: 3 Dietary analysis reports. Basically, keep tracking what you eat/drink for the first assignment and  for the rest you would be fine.
